gurmukhi: AMqk jm jb lYny AwvY ] liK iqh ko qb bwn clwvY ] miRq pyK kY ieq auq trY ] mwrXo kwlhU ko nhI mrY ]1712]
transliteration: Antak Jam Jab Laine Aavai|| Lakh(i) Tih Ko Tab Baan Chalaavai|| Mrit Pekh Kai It Out Darai|| Mdaryo Kaal-hoo Ko Nahidarai||1712||
translation: When the messengers of Yama came to take him, he even discharged his arrows towards them; he moved here and there, feeling his death at hand, but on being killed by the Kal (death), he was not dying.1712.

gurmukhi: puin SqRin idis iris kir DwXo ] mwnhu jm mUriq Dr AwXo ] ieau su ju`Du bYrn sMig krXo ] hir hir ibD suBtin mnu jrXo ]1713]
transliteration: Poun(i) Shatran(i) Dis(i) Ris(i) Kar(i)) Dhaayo|| Maanoh Jam Moondat(i) Dhar Aayo|| Io Su Juddh(u) Bairan San(i) Daryo|| Har(i) Har(i) Bidh Soubhatan(i) Man(u) Daryo||1713||
translation: He again, in his fury, fell upon in the direction of the enemy and it seemed that Yama himself was coming in person; he began to fight with the enemies, when, observing this, Krishna and Shiva were infuriated in their minds.1713.

gurmukhi: hwir prY mn hwr krY iehY ieau niRp ju`D biRQw n kr`eIXY ] fwr dY hwQn qy hQIAwrn kop qjo suK SwNiq sm`eIXY ]
transliteration: Daar(i) Darai Man Haar Darai Ihai Io Nrip Juddh Brithaa Na Karaeeeeyai|| Dar Dai Haathan Te Hatheeaaran Kop Tajo Soukh Shaant(i) Samaeeeeyai||
translation: Being tired, they began to persuade the king by saying, “O king! do not fight now uselessly; there is no warrior like you in all the three worlds and your praise has spread in all these worlds:

gurmukhi: sUr n koaU BXo qumry sm qyro pRqwp iqhU pur g`eIXY ] Cwfiq hY hm SsqR sBY su ibvwn cVo sur Dwm isD`eIXY ]1714]
transliteration: Soor Na Ko( i)  Bhayo Toumre Sam Tero Prataap Tihoo Pur Gadeeeyai|| Chhaadat(i) Hai Ham Shastra Sabhai Su Bivaan Chado Sur Dhaam Sidhaeeeeyai||1714||
translation: “Abandoning your weapons and ire, now be peaceful; we all forsake our weapons; go to heaven, mounting on the air-vehicle.”1714.

gurmukhi: sB dyvn Aru kiRSn dIn hÍY jb khXo ] hto ju`D qy BUp hmo muK qiRn ghXo ]
transliteration: Sabh Devan Ar(u) Krishan Deen Hvai Jab Kahyo|| Hato Juddh Te Bhoop Hamo Moukh Trin Gadyo||
translation: When all the gods and Krishna said these words very humbly and taking the blades of straw in their mouths, they went away from the battlefield,

gurmukhi: niRp suin Awqur bYn su kopu invwirXo ] ho DnuK bwn idE fwr rwm mnu DwirXo ]1715]
transliteration: Nrip Soun(i) Aatur Bain Su Kop(u) Nivaariyo|| Ho Dhanoukh Baan Dio Daar Raam Man(u) Dhaariyo||1715||
translation: Then listening to their words of distress, the king also abandoned his anger and put his bow and arrows on the earth.1715.

gurmukhi: ikMnr j`C Ap`Crin lXo ibvwn cFwie ] jYjYkwr Apwr sun hrKy muin sur rwie ]1716]
transliteration: Kinar Jachchh Apachchhran(i) Layo Bivaan Chadhaae|| Jai-jai-kaar Apaar Soun Harkhe Mounndi) Sur Raae||1716||
translation: The Kinnars, Yakshas and the heavenly damsels got him mounted on the ari-vehicle and listening to the shouts hailing him, even Indra, king of the gods also got pleased.1716.

gurmukhi: BUp gXo sur lok jbY qb sUr pRsMin Bey sb hI ] ieh BwNiq khY rn mY isgry muiK kwl ky jwie bcY Ab hI ]
transliteration: Bhoop Gado Sur Lok Jabai Tab Soor Prasann(i) Bhae Sab Hee|| Eh Bhaant(i) Kahai Ran Mai Sigre Moukh(i) Kaal Ke Jaae Bachai Ab Hee||
translation: When the king reached the abode of gods, all the warriors became pleased and said, “We are all saved from the mouth of Kal (death);”

gurmukhi: sis Bwn DnwiDp rudR ibrMc sBY hir qIr gey jb hI ] hrKy brKy nB qy sur PUl su jIq kI bMb bjI qb hI ]1717]
transliteration: Sas(i) Bhaan Dhanaadhip Rudra Biranch Sabhai Har(i) Teer Gad Jab Hee|| Harkhe Barkhe Nabh Te Sur Phool Su Jeet Kibanb Bajitab Hee||1717||
translation: When Chandra, Surya, Kuber, Rudra, Brahma etc. reached the abode of the Lord, the gods showered flowers from the sky and blew the horn of victory.1717.
